index-content.head_title: #Comparison Solution | On Premise APIs and Free App - GroupDocs
index-content.head_description: #Add watermark to PDF, images and documents. Watermarking Solution for Microsoft Office, PDF, OpenDocument, Image File Formats and more.
index-content.title: #Comparison Solution for Documents
index-content.description: #Quickly apply & manipulate text and image based watermarks of your documents and images with smart search.
index-content.api_high_1_content: #Search, add or remove text or image watermarks from multitude of file formats within your .NET applications.
index-content.api_high_2_content: #On Premise APIs for Java based applications to manipulate watermarks for MS Office, OpenOffice, portable documents, image, drawings and more.
index-content.api_low_1_content: #Use watermark REST API with .NET SDK to apply, find, edit and remove watermarks from document formats within .NET applications.
index-content.api_low_2_content: #Empower your Java applications with flexible watermarks management features using watermark SDK for Java.
index-content.api_nocode_1_content: #Free on-line app to add watermarks to Word, PowerPoint, Excel, PDF and 40+ other file formats.
index-content.api_nocode_2_content: #Add text-based watermarks to Microsoft Word documents on-line.
index-content.api_nocode_3_content: #Online free app providing the capability to watermark PDF documents.
index-content.actions_description: Try GroupDocs.Comparison features for free or request a license
index-content.code_comment_2: Add one or more target documents
index-content.code_comment_4: Perform the comparison and save the resulting document

sample_1.comment_1: Load the source document and specify its password
sample_1.comment_2: Load the target document and specify its password
sample_1.comment_3: Save comparison result to a specified file

index-content-net.head_title: .NET Document Comparison Library | Compare Docs for Text & Style
index-content-net.head_description: .NET API to compare document style & content. Compare documents of multiple supported formats for the difference to identify changes between files.
index-content-net.title: Compare & check files using .NET API
index-content-net.description: Develop .NET applications with a highly configurable document comparison API. Compare files based on content and text style across similar document formats.
index-content-net.overview_description: API to compare differences between documents in .NET applications

overview_feature_1.title: File comparison in C#
overview_feature_1.description: Detect differences between source and target files for changes at paragraphs, words, and character levels. Identify styling and formatting changes like bold, italic, underlines, strike-troughs, font types, etc.

overview_feature_2.title: Most popular file and document formats are supported
overview_feature_2.description: With GroupDocs.Comparison API you can efficiently compare documents of any supported formats like PDF, HTML, e-mail, Microsoft Office Word documents, Excel spreadsheets, PowerPoint presentations, OneNote, Visio diagrams, texts, JPEG, PNG, GIF, and BMP images as well as many other formats.

overview_feature_3.title: Apply or reject changes easily
overview_feature_3.description: Every difference between the compared documents can be applied or rejected and then exported to the output document.

overview_feature_4.title: Comparison summary report
overview_feature_4.description: Save a differences summary report that lists all changes in compared documents.

features.title: GroupDocs.Comparison features
features.description: Easily compare PDF and Office documents, images and other formats

feature_1.title: Side by side comparison
feature_1.content: Analyze and identify differences within two documents.

feature_2.title: Compare multiple documents
feature_2.content: Analyze and identify differences within multiple documents simultaneously.

feature_3.title: Supported formats
feature_3.content: Supports more than 50 popular document formats from various categories.

feature_4.title: Accept or reject changes
feature_4.content: Clear visual representation of identified changes, providing the option to accept or reject modifications.

feature_5.title: Generate previews
feature_5.content: Save the results of the comparison as images.

feature_6.title: Content comparison
feature_6.content: Compare text content line-by-line, by paragraphs, by words, by characters. Highlight the changes.

feature_7.title: Style comparison
feature_7.content: Detect changes in formatting and styles.

feature_8.title: Set metadata
feature_8.content: Keep metadata from either the source or target files or allow it to be specified by users.

feature_9.title: Password protection
feature_9.content: Analyze the encrypted documents, or secure the resulting document with a password.

feature_10.title: Compare specific pages
feature_10.content: Load just the particular sections or pages of the document.

feature_11.title: Display comments
feature_11.content: When loading the source document you can choose whether to hide or show comments.

index-content-net.platforms_description: GroupDocs.Comparison for .NET supports the following operating systems, frameworks and package managers
index-content-net.formats_description: GroupDocs.Comparison for .NET supports operations with the following [file formats](https://docs.groupdocs.com/comparison/net/supported-document-formats/).
index-content-net.code_samples_description: Some use cases of typical GroupDocs.Comparison for .NET operations
index-content-net.code_samples_sample_1_content: To compare documents that are [protected with a password](https://docs.groupdocs.com/comparison/net/load-password-protected-documents/), you need to specify it then loading the documents:
index-content-net.code_samples_sample_2_content: GroupDocs.Comparison allows you to [compare more than two documents](https://docs.groupdocs.com/comparison/net/compare-multiple-documents/). The operation is almost the same as when comparing two files. You just need to add more target files to the `comparer` class.

index-content-java.head_title: Java Document Comparison Library | Compare Docs for Text & Style
index-content-java.head_description: Java API to compare document style & content. Compare documents of multiple formats to identify differences.
index-content-java.title: Compare & check files using Java API
index-content-java.description: Develop Java applications with a highly configurable document comparison library to compare similar document formats, including files, their content, and text style.
index-content-java.overview_description: API to compare differences between documents in Java applications

overview_feature_1.title: File comparison in Java
overview_feature_1.description: Detect changes between source and target files at paragraph, word, and character levels. Identify styling and formatting changes such as bold, italic, underlines, strike-throughs, font types, and more.

overview_feature_2.title: Vast number of supported formats
overview_feature_2.description: With the GroupDocs.Comparison API, you can easily compare documents of multiple supported formats. This includes PDF, HTML, email, Microsoft Office Word documents, Excel spreadsheets, PowerPoint presentations, OneNote, Visio diagrams, texts, JPEG, PNG, GIF, and BMP images, as well as many other formats.

overview_feature_3.title: Apply or reject changes easily
overview_feature_3.description: Every difference between the compared documents can be applied or rejected and then exported to the output document.

overview_feature_4.title: Comparison summary report
overview_feature_4.description: Generate a summary report that lists all changes in the compared documents.

index-content-nodejs-java.head_title: Node.js Document Comparison Library | Compare Docs for Text & Style
index-content-nodejs-java.head_description: Node.js documents style & content comparison API. Compare documents of multiple supported formats for the difference to identify changes between files.
index-content-nodejs-java.title: Node.js API to compare popular file formats
index-content-nodejs-java.description: Document Comparison library to develop native JavaScript applications with highly configurable comparison features. Compare files, their content & text style between similar document formats.
index-content-nodejs-java.actions_description: Try GroupDocs.Comparison features for free, or request a license
index-content-nodejs-java.code_comment_2: Set up another file for comparison
index-content-nodejs-java.code_comment_3: Save comparison result to specified file
index-content-nodejs-java.overview_description: API to compare various types of documents such as PDF, Microsoft Office, HTML, e-mails, or images within Node.js applications

overview_feature_1.title: Detailed output reports
overview_feature_1.description: GroupDocs.Comparison identifies changes in document content (characters, words, paragraphs, tables, charts), as well as, changes in document style. It provides customers with a resulting report that contains rich information about differences, their number, and type.

overview_feature_2.title: Most popular file and document formats are supported
overview_feature_2.description: With GroupDocs.Comparison API you can efficiently compare documents of any supported formats like PDF, HTML, e-mail, Microsoft Office Word documents, Excel spreadsheets, PowerPoint presentations, OneNote, Visio diagrams, texts, JPEG, PNG, GIF, and BMP images as well as many other formats.

overview_feature_3.title: Documentation and examples
overview_feature_3.description: There is already a lot of documentation on using Comparison library on different platforms with code examples, so you don’t have to think hard about how to work with GroupDocs.Comparison API in your Node.js application.

index-content-nodejs-java.platforms_description: GroupDocs.Comparison for Node.js supports the following operating systems, frameworks and package managers
index-content-nodejs-java.formats_description: GroupDocs.Comparison for Node.js via Java supports operations with the following [file formats](https://docs.groupdocs.com/comparison/nodejs-java/supported-document-formats/).
